name: Compton Bay and Downs Walk, Isle of Wight

ai.summary: An ambitious coastal trek on the Isle of Wight, the Compton Bay and Downs Walk covers 37.4 km of sea cliffs, chalk downs and rural lanes. It threads dramatic coastal scenery from Compton Bay along exposed downs, with sweeping sea views, rugged ground and remote stretches.
ai.terrain_summary: The route combines rugged coastal paths along chalk cliffs, exposed downland ridges, uneven footing and stone tracks, plus quiet farm lanes and occasional road sections. Expect steep ascents and descents, loose gravel, and variable weather and wind exposure.
ai.safety_notes: This is a long, exposed coastal route. Check weather conditions, tides, and wind; stay well back from cliff edges, as erosion can be unpredictable. Carry ample water and high-energy food; wear sturdy footwear and layered clothing. Have a map, compass or GPS, and tell someone your planned timings and route. Phone signal may be patchy in rural sections; start early in shorter daylight months.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing with a waterproof jacket and trousers
Headlamp or flashlight with spare batteries
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) when daylight and weather are more favorable for long coastal walking.
